The set difference of <math>A</math> and <math>B</math> written as <math>A\setminus B</math> is defined as<math display="block">\left\{ x : x \in A \text{ and } x \not\in B \right\}</math>

== Important Properties ==

* When <math>A \subseteq B</math> then <math>\left| B\setminus A \right|= \left| B \right| - \left| A \right|</math>
** This is because you can write <math>B = B\setminus  A \cup A</math>, and <math>B \setminus A, A </math> are disjoint therefore <math>\left| B \right|= \left| B \setminus A \right| + \left| A \right| </math>  so we have that <math>\left| B\setminus A \right| = \left| B \right| - \left| A \right|</math>
